NOTES: General “what”; can stand alone as a question (อะไร?) or follow a noun
“When?” (past or future); often written เมื่อไร in text
Same word for “who” as subject or object
Used after the noun or alone for “which one?”
Used with verbs and in questions like …ได้ไหม to ask “can / is it okay?”
“Or” between choices; also appears at the end of a sentence as a softer question
Often used alone with money or amounts (เท่าไหร่? = how much?)
Must be followed by a classifier (e.g., กี่คน, กี่เล่ม)
Used at the end of most questions by women or when calling someone (rising tone)
Flexible linker; in ไหนก็ได้ it helps give the meaning “whichever / any is fine”
